pr_title: Convert authentication call to POST body and convert login to Kotlin
pr_body:
Fixes #1515 

**Changes** 
- Created a new payload file for login containing data class for the new API call's body.
- Modified all occurrences of the older login methods containing strings to use the Login payload.
- Modified all unit tests to work with the new authentication method
- Added `kapt` plugin and used it over Java annotation processors for supporting kotlin annotations in the app.
- Converted the LoginActivity completely (Including its presenters and models) to Kotlin.


**Log output for working log in**
```
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: --> POST https://mobile.mifos.io/fineract-provider/api/v1/self/authentication http/1.1
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Content-Length: 47
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: {"password":"password","username":"mifos_user"}
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: --> END POST (47-byte body)
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: <-- 200  https://mobile.mifos.io/fineract-provider/api/v1/self/authentication (1502ms)
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Server: nginx/1.4.6 (Ubuntu)
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Date: Sun, 28 Jun 2020 14:38:09 GMT
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Content-Type: application/json
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Transfer-Encoding: chunked
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Connection: keep-alive
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Pragma: no-cache
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Expires: 0
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000 ; includeSubDomains
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: X-Frame-Options: DENY
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
org.mifos.mobile D/OkHttp: {"username":"mifos_user","userId":246,"base64EncodedAuthenticationKey":"bWlmb3NfdXNlcjpwYXNzd29yZA\u003d\u003d","authenticated":true,"officeId":1,"officeName":"FOVISSSTE","staffId":1,"staffDisplayName":"xyz, test1","roles":[{"id":2,"name":"Self Service User","description":"self service user role","disabled":false}],"permissions":["ALL_FUNCTIONS","ALL_FUNCTIONS_READ","CHECKER_SUPER_USER","BYPASS_TWOFACTOR","REPORTING_SUPER_USER"],"shouldRenewPassword":false,"isTwoFactorAuthenticationRequired":false}
```
---

- [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.

- [x] Run the unit tests with `./gradlew check` to make sure you didn't break anything

- [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.

pr_body:
Solves Issue(s):  #1530 

Converted the following classes which were previously in Java, to Kotlin.

1. Passcode activity
2. Constants
3. Convert Registration activity
4. Home activity and fragments
5. Base activity and fragments
6. API related classes 
7. All View classes
8. All classes under `/main/../ui` (Activities, Adapters, Enums, Views, Widgets, Fragments)
9. All Adapter classes
10. All Presenter classes
11. All JUnit tests 
12. All activity classes
13. All model classes
14. All Injection classes
15. MifosSelfService class
16. commonTest and androidTest classes 

---

- [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.

- [x] Run the unit tests with `./gradlew check` to make sure you didn't break anything

- [ ] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them 
(Separate commits for easier reviews. Will squash after the final review)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 457564775, 'comment_body': 'I think it is much better to use the safe call `?.` (One of the biggest advantages of using Kotlin) instead of `!!`, because it leads the App to crash if our view or any other item is null or it has not been initiated. You can replace all `!!` to `?.` in a file, simply by entering `Ctlr+r`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 17, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jawidMuhammadi', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457572667, 'comment_body': "If we are using **Kotlin** then isn't it better to optimize our code a little more and decrease lines of code. Like, here, I think there is no need for those 3 lines of code(23,24,25) and in all other places. We can simply call `tv_app_version` whenever we want using **Kotlin android-synthetics**", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 17, 24, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jawidMuhammadi', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 458107420, 'comment_body': "Thank you for your insights @jawidMuhammadi. I guess I had failed to notice a lot of not-null assertion operators since this conversion was straight from Java. Though there are quite a few functions in the app which requires a non-null object (For instance, `ButterKnife.bind()` is a Java function and doesn't support null safety yet), I would check for usages where safe call is possible and update it soon. Thanks again :)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 21, 13, 44, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460905979, 'comment_body': 'Sorry for the late reply on this, I just noticed this comment. Firstly, KotlinX android synthetics is now regarded to be not a recommended practice anymore [[1]](https://android-review.googlesource.com/c/platform/frameworks/support/+/882241) [[2]](https://old.reddit.com/r/androiddev/comments/ala9p2/why_kotlinx_synthetic_is_no_longer_a_recommended/efdvpkg/) since it was replaced with `findViewById`. I did not use that either since the app already used ButterKnife for ViewBinding and I had to primarily focus on completely converting the app to Kotlin first. I will discuss and get back on if I should replace ButterKnife. Thank you for the suggestions and do let me know if there are any more optimization suggestions from your side :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 27, 13, 53, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471656942, 'comment_body': 'Why is this `screenOrientation` added. Please clarify', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 17, 46, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'miPlodder', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471665413, 'comment_body': 'If the orientation is landscape in the passcode activity, the UI elements go out of bounds. mifos-mobile-cn also had a similar [problem](https://github.com/openMF/mifos-mobile-cn/issues/108) which was solved by restricting the orientation to only portrait. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 18, 0, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Contains basic structure for Kotlin multi-platform in mifos mobile and uses a common function `createApplicationScreenMessage()` which is implemented on both android and iOS.

### Screenshots
#### iOS
![Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 10 26 38 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20596763/90670177-724bb480-e270-11ea-82d9-961da49e5934.png)

#### Android (Toast)
![Screenshot from 2020-08-19 23-00-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20596763/90670123-59db9a00-e270-11ea-855f-13816b34f872.png)

pr_title: feat: Add UI Tests for Login flow with Espresso
pr_body:
Uses the espresso library to perform UI tests for complete login flow


Steps implemented: - Enter username: _ashwinr_ - Enter password: _password_ - Tap password visibility toggle twice - Press login button - Wait for login request to complete (Uses `CountingIdlingResource`) - Checks if passcode activity layout is properly loaded and displayed - Tap password visibility toggle - Perform swipe up action to make the digit _0_ and _proceed_ buttons visible in smaller devices (Required for Travis CI to pass) - Tap digit _0_ four times (To input passcode as 0000) - Press proceed button - Perform passcode input again - Press save button - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio. - [x] Run the unit tests with `./gradlew check` to make sure you didn't break anything - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 479615934, 'comment_body': "I don't think, for writing integration tests or be it unit test we will have to make changes in the testing classes, check on this.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 6, 38, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'miPlodder', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479616115, 'comment_body': 'Did this change fix the Travis build issue, if yes then please share the reference?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 6, 40, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'miPlodder', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479616376, 'comment_body': 'Was `expressoVersion` already existing?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 6, 44, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'miPlodder', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479616841, 'comment_body': 'Is it an integration test for a single flow, clarify. If not split it multiple flows into multiple tests, instead of covering all flows in a single test method.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 6, 50, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'miPlodder', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479649079, 'comment_body': 'Using `EspressoIdlingResource` demands production-level code be altered for letting Espresso know that the UI is being updated due to a task. This is preferred over sleeping the thread in the test resource. More information is available in the [documentation](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/test/espresso/idling/CountingIdlingResource/) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 13, 18, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479649297, 'comment_body': 'It is a recommended practice to disable animations in the device for testing. It is also mentioned [here](https://developer.android.com/training/testing/espresso/setup#set-up-environment) in the  documentation for espresso', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 13, 21, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479649339, 'comment_body': 'Yes. The test implementation was also previously mentioned [here](https://github.com/openMF/mifos-mobile/blob/95cc2fd10d3a62509d4fb7fd1ffeaae868f6c120/app/build.gradle#L164)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 13, 21, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ashwinkey04', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479649607, 'comment_body': 'This test is meant to cover the login flow completely.
